item.title: Hriday add a quote by W. Somerset Maugham
item.description: "To acquire the habit of reading is to construct for yourself a refuge from almost all the miseries of life." -- W. Somerset Maugham

item.title: Hriday add a quote by W. Somerset Maugham
item.description: "Cronshaw stopped for a moment to drink. He had pondered for twenty years the problem whether he loved liquor because it made him talk or whether he loved conversation because it made him thirsty." -- W. Somerset Maugham

item.title: Hriday add a quote by Agatha Christie
item.description: "If you are to be Hercule Poirot, you must think of everything." -- Agatha Christie

item.title: Hriday add a quote by H. Jackson Brown Jr.
item.description: "Twenty years from now you will be more disappointed by the things that you didn't do than by the ones you did do. So throw off the bowlines. Sail away from the safe harbor. Catch the trade winds in your sails. Explore. Dream. Discover." -- H. Jackson Brown Jr.

item.title: Hriday add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "I have never let my schooling interfere with my education." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Hriday add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Be careful about reading health books. You may die of a misprint." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Hriday add a quote by Paul Terry
item.description: "Whenever I feel the need to exercise, I lie down until it goes away." -- Paul Terry

item.title: Hriday add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Classic' - a book which people praise and don't read." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Hriday add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Keep away from people who try to belittle your ambitions. Small people always do that, but the really great make you feel that you, too, can become great." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Hriday add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "I must have a prodigious amount of mind; it takes me as much as a week, sometimes, to make it up!" -- Mark Twain

item.title: Hriday add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "So many books, so little time." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: Hriday add a quote by Bernard M. Baruch
item.description: "Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter, and those who matter don't mind." -- Bernard M. Baruch

item.title: Hriday add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: Hriday add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Be the change that you wish to see in the world." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Hriday add a quote by Elie Wiesel
item.description: "The opposite of love is not hate, it's indifference. The opposite of art is not ugliness, it's indifference. The opposite of faith is not heresy, it's indifference. And the opposite of life is not death, it's indifference." -- Elie Wiesel

item.title: Hriday add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "You must write every single day of your life... You must lurk in libraries and climb the stacks like ladders to sniff books like perfumes and wear books like hats upon your crazy heads... may you be in love every day for the next 20,000 days. And out of that love, remake a world." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Hriday add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "I would challenge you to a battle of wits, but I see you are unarmed!" -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Hriday add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "Outside of a dog, a book is man's best friend. Inside of a dog it's too dark to read." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Hriday add a quote by Abraham Lincoln
item.description: "Books serve to show a man that those original thoughts of his aren't very new after all." -- Abraham Lincoln

item.title: Hriday add a quote by Abraham Lincoln
item.description: "Do I not destroy my enemies when I make them my friends?" -- Abraham Lincoln

item.title: Hriday add a quote by Abraham Lincoln
item.description: "It has been my experience that folks who have no vices have very few virtues." -- Abraham Lincoln

item.title: Hriday add a quote by Abraham Lincoln
item.description: "You have to do your own growing no matter how tall your grandfather was." -- Abraham Lincoln

item.title: Hriday add a quote by Abraham Lincoln
item.description: "It's not me who can't keep a secret. It's the people I tell that can't." -- Abraham Lincoln

item.title: Hriday add a quote by Ishmael Reed
item.description: "No one says a novel has to be one thing. It can be anything it wants to be, a vaudeville show, the six o’clock news, the mumblings of wild men saddled by demons." -- Ishmael Reed

item.title: Hriday add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "If we listened to our intellect we'd never have a love affair. We'd never have a friendship. We'd never go in business because we'd be cynical: "It's gonna go wrong." Or "She's going to hurt me." Or,"I've had a couple of bad love affairs, so therefore . . ." Well, that's nonsense. You're going to miss life. You've got to jump off the cliff all the time and build your wings on the way down." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Hriday add a quote by H.G. Wells
item.description: "Moral indignation is jealousy with a halo." -- H.G. Wells

item.title: Hriday add a quote by Doris Lessing
item.description: "Whatever you're meant to do, do it now. The conditions are always impossible." -- Doris Lessing

item.title: Hriday add a quote by Julian Barnes
item.description: "Books say: She did this because. Life says: She did this. Books are where things are explained to you; life is where things aren't. I'm not surprised some people prefer books." -- Julian Barnes

item.title: Hriday add a quote by Julian Barnes
item.description: "The greatest patriotism is to tell your country when it is behaving dishonorably, foolishly, viciously." -- Julian Barnes

item.title: Hriday add a quote by Julian Barnes
item.description: "It strikes me that this may be one of the differences between youth and age: when we are young, we invent different futures for ourselves; when we are old, we invent different pasts for others." -- Julian Barnes
